text: breadth-first search, breadth-first search algorithm, Breadth-First Search implementation on BPL, Breadth-First Search, tree search, Breadth-First Search is a tree search strategy for covering all points in a graph so that each point is covered by one of the next two nodes if the root node of the tree expands all successo rs. This algorithm uses Breadth-First Search to find the shortest path from a start node to every other node in a tree with a given number of leaf-nodes and a fixed-size memory, which must be saved into memory at each step of the solution.
